articles.author: Timour Azhari
articles.description: Students returned to classrooms in Syria on Sunday after the country's new rulers ordered schools reopened in a potent sign of some normalcy a week after rebels swept into the capital in the dramatic overthrow of President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.title: Syrian authorities reopen schools, a week after upheaval that overthrew Assad

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The threats to Israel from Syria remain despite the moderate tone of rebel leaders who ousted President Bashar al-Assad a week ago, Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz said on Sunday, amid military moves by his country to counter such threats.
articles.title: Israel sees increased threat from Syria despite moderate tone of rebel leaders

articles.author: Huseyin Hayatsever
articles.description: The new administration in Syria should be given a chance to govern following their constructive messages, and Turkey stands ready to provide military training if such help is requested, Turkish Defence Minister Yasar Guler said.
articles.title: Turkey ready to offer military training to Syria if new administration requests, minister says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Another tanker was also in distress after sustaining damage, Russian officials said. At least one person was killed.
articles.title: Oil spills into Kerch Strait after Russian tanker breaks apart in storm

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 11 people were killed after a cyclone slammed into Mayotte, the most intense storm to hit the French Indian Ocean archipelago north of Madagascar in nearly a century, French weather forecasters and authorities said on Sunday.
articles.title: Cyclone slams into France's Mayotte archipelago, killing at least 11

articles.author: Michel Rose
articles.description: Francois Bayrou will face a fractured and fractious parliament where one of his earliest tasks will be to pass a budget for 2025.
articles.title: Macron has a new prime minister but the same old problems

articles.author: Heekyong Yang, Josh Smith
articles.description: Han convened his cabinet and National Security Council after Saturday's impeachment vote and vowed to maintain military readiness to prevent any breach of national security.
articles.title: South Korea's acting president moves to reassure allies, calm markets after impeachment

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australia's government said on Sunday that five members of the "Bali Nine" drug ring have returned from Indonesia, after diplomatic efforts between the countries this month to strike a repatriation deal.
articles.title: Australia says remaining 'Bali Nine' members have returned from Indonesia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The DRC said Rwanda made the signing of a peace agreement conditional on Congo holding direct talks with M23 rebels, which Congo rejected.
articles.title: Congo and Rwanda say peace talks in Angola will not take place

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Pope Francis urged Catholic priests on Sunday to guard against spiritual groups that stoke political divisions, speaking during a one-day visit to Corsica, the first by a pontiff to the French Mediterranean island.
articles.title: Pope Francis, in Corsica, warns against religion that stokes divisions
